climbs.name: What is This? A Dyno For Ants?!

content.description:
This is a one move wonder. Start with a good right hand in a small vertical crack and your left hand on the adjacent shelf. Get your feet set, and jump up and left for the lip.

A video:

https://vimeo.com/363067549

.
content.location: This problem is in the 'corridor' itself. Start in the middle section of the shorter (southern) wall with a good right hand hold in a vertical crack.

climbs.name: Slap The Bag
climbs.fa: Charlie Izurieta, Cory Henchen, Cam Lynch, May 2019

content.description: SDS low left on a good undercling. Move up and right through a series of good edges. Once the edges run out, throw it to the top, and slap a fancy sloper. Mantel to the top, and become one with the bat poop.
content.location: On the way to the corridor, walk towards a large, tower-like rock. At the base, you will find a clean face that is broken in half by a chimney-like feature. Slap The Bag is the first route to the right of the chimney.

content.description:
This is a harder link-up to

Amazon Crime

. Start with both hands on a right-facing edge, then, with your feet on the big starting ledge, reach up and left to a good crimp in the concave portion of the wall. Use fishy heel hooks and slapping to get up and right to the big block at the top of

Amazon Crime

, and finish right.

A video:

https://vimeo.com/364512250

.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter on the opposite side of the corridor.
content.location:
In the corridor, on the taller (northern) wall, the start holds are just to the left of

Amazon Crime

on a right-facing edge.

content.description: Stand start on good holds, and do a long move to a sharp jug. This is pretty much a one move wonder, but it is worth the go.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the obvious east face of the boulder below the corridor, left of

The Cleric

, V5.

content.description: Start low, and climb the odd-looking overhang using heel hooks and good slopers.
content.location: This is a stand-alone problem in between the Cleric Boulder and the corridor created by two large blocks.

content.description: Start low on the right side of the boulder with a right hand undercling and right heel hook. Climb up and slightly right using crimpers and a sloping sidepull to gain the juggy topout. There are a selection of holds down low that yield multiple options for the start. The crux is about halfway up, so the grade seems consistent regardless of how you decide to start the route.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter would be nice.
content.location: This is on the east face of a free-standing boulder that is located just south and downhill from the actual corridor.

content.description: Start on good holds, then move up and left to a huge jug rail. From here, reach to the lip, and top out.
content.location: In the 'corridor' on the shorter (southern) wall, start on good holds in a small vertical crack in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Sit start on good blocky holds, and move into the stand start (same grade) up and right. From here, bust a reachy move up and left, then using a slot and a higher shelf, top out on the shorter part of the boulder. This is super fun, but it would help to have a spotter for the top moves.

A video:

https://vimeo.com/363067887

.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter on the opposite wall of the corridor.
content.location: In the 'corridor' on the taller (northern) wall, start in the middle, low on the blocky shelves. Locate chalked holds on subsequent shelves to see where you're going.
